ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Description of person or group of people about whom participant is answering questions
Notes: e.g., Partner 1, Friend 2, neighbors

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Chores: Problems about household chores such as keeping your room clean, doing the dishes, shoveling snow, or setting the table.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Appearance: Problems about the way you look including keeping your hair neat and combed, and dressing neatly.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Homework and Schoolwork: Problems about homework or getting good grades.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Social Life: Problems when you see friends, when you go to parties or clubs, or the kinds of activities planned/done with friends.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Romantic Relationships: Problems about who you date, when you go out and get home from dates, or the kinds of activities planned/done on dates.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Bedtime and Curfew: Problems about what time you need to be home or when to go to bed.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Health: Problems about health, such as what you eat, exercise, or decisions about medical or dental appointments or treatments.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Choosing Activities: Problems about what activity is done and when it is done; such as amount of time talking on phone, watching T.V., playing sports, shopping, or not practicing lessons.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Money: Problems about the way money is spent, earned or saved.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Behavior and Personality: Problems about bad behavior or habits like being stubborn, talking too much, or disobeying rules.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Relationships with Brothers and Sisters: Problems about getting along with your brothers and sisters such as fighting with them, hitting, yelling, teasing, or hurting them.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day

ElementDescription: How often did you have disagreements with your (mother/father) during the past year? Relationships with Friends: Problems about getting along with your friends or fighting with them.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A couple of times; 3 = A few times each month; 4 = Several times a week; 5 = About once a day; 6 = Several times a day
